Posts.Content: I went to Walmart and found what they called a sleeping bra made of very soft tshirt type fabric. You step into it like a sports bra. It was very comfortable. However, as I continue to heal, I feel the bra pulling to one side. I told the nurse at the oncologist's office and was given a prescription for a mastectomy bra (I had a lumpectomy). You go to a place that specializes in this, get measured and, in my case, Medicare will pay for the bras.
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Since my diagnosis in April 2015, lumpectomy in June 2015 & radiation in August & September 2015, I have been taking Arimidex. Naturally, the hot flashes & night sweats are awful. However, where I had suffered with vaginal dryness for several years, I now am wet. Has anyone else had this occur? Is it part of it or should I be worried that something else is wrong?
Posts.Title: Having Wetness
